item.title: Manually Adding NFTs to Your Stoic Wallet
item.dc:creator: Jorgen Builder
item.content:encoded:
Disclaimer: Iâ€™m an independent developer and have no affiliation with Toniq Labs or StoicÂ Wallet.

If you hold Internet Computer NFTs in your Stoic Wallet, you might notice that occasionally they donâ€™t show up. This can be the case for many newer NFT projects, where Stoic Wallet has not yet completed an integration. In these instances, you can manually add your NFTs to get them to appear in yourÂ wallet.

As of this writing, you do this using the â€œ+â€ button at the top of your wallet, pictured above. This will bring up a text input field, where you can input either a canister id, or a token id. Once you add a canister or a token from a particular canister, your Stoic Wallet should then discover any NFTs from that canister from that momentÂ on.

Youâ€™re done! You should see your NFTs in your wallet. If you donâ€™t know how to find your canister or token id, take a look at itsÂ URL:

https://cwu5z-wyaaa-aaaaj-qaoaq-cai.raw.ic0.app/0?type=thumbnail&tokenid=spj3g-4ikor-uwiaa-aaaaa-cmacg-aaqca-aaaaa-a

The part beforeÂ .raw.ic0.app is the canister id, and the part after tokenid= is your token id. So if you want to add your Series #0 The Fool, use the canister id â€œnges7-giaaa-aaaaj-qaiya-caiâ€ and if you want to add Series #1 The Magician, use the canister id â€œcwu5z-wyaaa-aaaaj-qaoaq-cai.â€

â€œI Still Canâ€™t SeeÂ It!â€

Well, Stoic Wallet has another quirk. If tokens that you manually added to the wallet donâ€™t show up, tryÂ this.

Click your ICPÂ Balance:

Then Click your NFTÂ Balance:

Your NFT(s) should now beÂ visible.

â€œWow, Thatâ€™s Difficultâ€¦â€

Yes it is! Our project also supports the Plug wallet, which doesnâ€™t experience any of these issues. Solutions to these bugs are already complete, we are just waiting on Toniq Labs to acceptÂ them.

â€œWhy Do I Even Need To DoÂ This?â€

Currently NFT projects often need to work one-on-one with wallet projects to make their NFTs â€œauto discoverâ€ in each wallet. The work itself is very simple, but it requires lots of coordination, review, and duplicate work for developers on both sides of the equation. A better approach would be to have a community owned service (or maybe several services) that can tackle this work. Psychedelic DAO has already released a project thatâ€™s a great start: DAB. If we can coordinate the community around projects like that DAB, we can fix problems like having to manually punch in funny strings to work with our NFTsÂ ğŸ˜Š

UPDATE: Stoic Wallet is working on integrating DAB, so that this step wonâ€™t be necessary. Unfortunately it is not complete yet as of thisÂ writing.

item.dc:creator: Jorgen Builder
item.content:encoded:
Itâ€™s chilly and dark in the northern latitudes ğŸ¥¶ so while people start to cozy up for holiday time with friends and family ğŸªµğŸ”¥ğŸ… Iâ€™d like to share whatâ€™s been happening with Saga Tarot and what comesÂ next.

The First PublicÂ Sale

On December 10th, 2021, Saga launched its first public sale of 90 NFTs on the Internet Computer blockchain, which sold out in about 30 minutes! Itâ€™s a small launch by some standards, but Iâ€™m extremely grateful for this reception, very proud of the work that contributors put in, and so excited to iterate and move on to the next release with all ofÂ you!

The Next PublicÂ Sale

You can now preview the next Legend, The Magician, on the legends homepage. This release will happen in January 2022, but the exact date is not yet determined. We intend to use each subsequent release as an opportunity to improve upon the last, so letâ€™s preview some of what we aim to do better with the release of The Magician.

More Card TrimÂ Variety

The Saxon Story Teller is creating new card backs and borders that will add more variety to The Magician, and provide collectors with the ability to craft more unique tarot card decks with the Deck Crafting feature in the future. Some of these trims will be exclusive to this release, and some will also be available in future releases.

Better Transactions Technology

Based on our experience with the first public sale, weâ€™ve identified some technical objectives that will reduce the need for refunds. Transaction technology on the Internet Computer blockchain is in early days, and there should be some very significant improvements that we can make for later releases.

Pre-Sale Event

We will be holding a limited access pre-sale before the public sale for The Magician. Access to the pre-sale for The Magician will be granted to the following groups (the exact numbers here are subject to someÂ change):

  • Randomly selected holders of the first mintÂ (~5.)
  • The most engaged users in our upcoming discord community (~5.)
  • Everyone who had to be refunded in the first public saleÂ (~15.)
  • Community contributors (~15.)

We are also working with some collaborators to develop pre-sale tickets as NFTs. Thereâ€™s a chance that these tickets are ready for The Magicianâ€™s release, but no promises! These pre-sale tickets should add some fun network effects to future releases.

Community CofferÂ Update

10% of the proceeds from the first public sale were allocated to the community coffer. The goal of this fund is to share the profits with holders based on the value that those holders are providing to the project. What we want to avoid is behaving like a security. In my view, trading Legends, talking about Legends, and providing feedback on Legends are all added value (and thatâ€™s not an exhaustive list). Based on that, Iâ€™m hopeful that we will find a mechanism to reward the majority of holders who are not just silently speculating on LegendsÂ NFTs.

Ideally, this is something that holders will take time to contribute ideas toward. To that end, we will dedicate a chat room to this topic in the community Discord.

Discord Community

A discord is in the works now! We are getting some help from the folks that set up the Poked Bots discord, and they tell me that the discord will be ready before Christmas. Iâ€™m currently planning out roles for moderators and some fun events and perks for the discord community.

The Disk ofÂ Legends

If youâ€™ve read the Legends project homepage, youâ€™ll be familiar with the DoL, and you may wonder where yoursÂ is!

The first version will be ready in early January, and more features will be added at a laterÂ date.

For each legend that you mint, a rune will be added to your disk. For now, you will be able to use your disk as a social avatar to flex your status as a Saga supporter, and in the future it will unlock powerful features such as Deck Crafting.

Marketplace Update

Listing Legends on a marketplace is a top priority for us, and weâ€™re happy to say that Entrepot has reached out to assist with integrating their marketplace. My goal is to get this feature ready before the release of The Magician.

Thanks for stopping by for this update! If you have any questions you can reach out to @sagacards or @jorgenbuilder onÂ Twitter.
